shippingstore

Class TransactionDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • shippingstore.TransactionDatabase

  • public class TransactionDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to represent a database interface for a list of Transaction's. It using a plain-text file "TransactionDB.ser" to store and write transaction objects in serialized form. It contains an ArrayList called transactionList to store the database in a runtime friendly data structure. The transactionList is written to "TransactionDB.ser" at the end of the transactionList object's life by calling flush(). This class also provides methods for adding, remove, and searching for package orders from the list.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TransactionDatabase()
      This constructor is hard-coded to open "TransactionDB.ser" and initialize the transactionList with its contents.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransactionDatabase

        public TransactionDatabase()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor is hard-coded to open "TransactionDB.ser" and initialize the transactionList with its contents. If no such file exists, then one is created. The contents of the file are "loaded" into the transactionList ArrayList in no particular order. The file is then closed during the duration of the program until flush() is called.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it cannot create a file in the current directory

    • Method Detail

      • showTransactions

        public void showTransactions()
        Method showTransactions displays the current list of all completed transactions in no particular order

      • addTransaction

        public void addTransaction(User customer,
                           User employee,
                           PackageOrder p,
                           java.lang.String ship,
                           java.lang.String deliver,
                           java.lang.String cost)
        This method is used to add a transaction to the transaction ArrayList. In order for a transactino to be completed and added to the ArrayList it must comply with the following:

        1. Must have users of type customer and employee: an customer to request, and an employee to complete the transaction

        2. Valid ship and deliver dates formatted "MM/DD/YY"

        3. A non-negative cost.

        Parameters:
        customer - the User object who requested the transaction
        employee - the User object who completed the transaction
        p - the PackageOrder object shipped for this transaction
        ship - the String which represents the shipping date
        deliver - the String which represents the delivery date
        cost - the String which represents the shipping cost

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        This method opens "TransactionDB.ser" and overwrites it with a serialization of all the package orders in the transactionList. This should be the last method to be called before exiting the program.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it cannot create a file in the current directory
